programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A collection of Playboy Club memorabilia arrives in the shop. Plus, Corey and Chum check out a pair of old Murray bicycles.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chum are starstruck by a collection of autographed postcards from some of the biggest names in Hollywood, and Rick spots an authentic moonshine still.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys buy a valuable 1961 guitar, and discover a copy of National Geographic covering the first moon landing.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley hires a woman to work at the jewellery counter, without consulting with Seth or Les. Questions about Ashley's skills are raised after suspicious transactions.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les orders Seth and Rich to clean up the warehouse to make room for new merchandise. When nothing is done, the owner has doubts that his children are cut out for business.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimmie visits a famous hotel to examine some furniture, and the guys value a restored 1929 Ford fire engine.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimmie revisits his childhood with a 1950s Space Commander ride, and when his staff are late, sets them a challenge.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator's search for people with superhuman skills and powers leads him to a blind man who claims he can see with his mind.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The case of the fatal attack on Florida hotel manger Leonard Houda in July 2000, in which he was doused with acid in broad daylight. Investigators contended with numerous false tips and leads in a nationwide manhunt before the identity of the killer was revealed.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams go head-to-head breaking up typical boy racer cars to see whether a Citroen Saxo VTS or the Vauxhaull Corsa is worth more in scrap.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Uncovering the cities and government fortresses covertly constructed beneath US soil, including an advanced network of drug-smuggling tunnels.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: A look at the scandals that have rocked the secret service, its gruelling selection process and the people and secrets that its highly trained agents protect.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A think-tank of top global experts examines whether America's founding fathers hid extra-terrestrial secrets in their documents, buildings and symbols.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise prehistoric ruins, asking whether humans could have built such advanced structures alone, and examine the possibility of alien intervention.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Gold family and its employees are ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring in their unique items in the hope of raising some cash.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer brings in an Olympic torch used in the relay for the 2002 Winter Games, an event held in Salt Lake City, Utah.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les attends a business meeting, and as soon as he has gone Ashley tries to undermine Seth. A vicious standoff results after the vendors fail to agree a price of some jewellery. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man tries to sell a series of poorly stuffed animals, leading to to an unusual threat being made against Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman sells an artistic statue of an old woman in a bathing suit, but when Les buys it, Seth blames Ashley for contributing to the purchase.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny makes a series of extravagant bids to come out on top at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Veteran locker bidder Puffy - who also happens to be Ricky's mother - causes a commotion when she competes in a storage battle in upscale Haslet.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: For the Benefit of Mr Charles
programme.desc: Mary brings a mysterious friend to an auction, and Jenny adopts a bold new strategy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction season ends with a record-breaking sale, and Moe chooses the one purchase his wife allows him to make each year.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A piano, a tea set and some expensive furniture are among the finds up for grabs when the buyers go to Lewisville, Texas.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Dallas, where they attend several auctions in one day while facing a frantic race to keep up with the competition.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autograph of baseball legend Honus Wagner lands in the shop, and Rick checks out a first edition of Nabokov's controversial novel, Lolita.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1967 Shelby GT350 speeds into the shop, and Chumlee toys with the idea of buying one of the first video game consoles, a Magnavox Odyssey 200

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are shocked when a seller claims to own a cover for a thermo-nuclear warhead. Plus, a mandolin from Bob Wills' Texas Playboys shows up.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The shop opens its doors on vintage Aerosmith tour shirts and a US Navy foghorn. Corey examines a state-of-the-art survival vehicle built to fight zombies.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey checks out a Colt Army Model 1860 revolver from the Civil War, while Rick sets his sights on a Viking coin and Chum hatches a plan to get a pay rise.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A painted door from the former home of the Doors' Jim Morrison shows up. Corey checks out some rare motorcycles - but can Rick stop him from overspending?.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A collection of Playboy Club memorabilia arrives in the shop. Plus, Corey and Chum check out a pair of old Murray bicycles.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chum are starstruck by a collection of autographed postcards from some of the biggest names in Hollywood, and Rick spots an authentic moonshine still.

programme.title: America's Greatest Prison Breaks
programme.desc: An account of the breakout of escaped killers Richard Matt and David Sweat from Clinton Correctional Prison in New York, as it was investigated by US Marshals and other officials.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While monitoring the dangerous collapse at H8, the team conducts a test that could lead them straight to the Money Pit.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A think-tank of top global experts examines whether America's founding fathers hid extra-terrestrial secrets in their documents, buildings and symbols.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise prehistoric ruins, asking whether humans could have built such advanced structures alone, and examine the possibility of alien intervention.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel game in which question master Stephen Fry continues his exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L, asking a range of fiendish questions about levity, levitation and lights. Comedian and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe joins The Great British Bake Off presenter Sue Perkins, Room 101 host and stand-up Frank Skinner and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, first aired in June and hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, London Hughes, Rhys James and Milton Jones. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are EastEnders star June Brown, comedians Aisling Bea and Seann Walsh, and football presenter Adrian Chiles.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions about literature and language. Stand-up comedian Lloyd Langford joins Bad Education star Jack Whitehall, Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel game in which question master Stephen Fry continues his exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L, asking a range of fiendish questions about levity, levitation and lights. Comedian and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe joins The Great British Bake Off presenter Sue Perkins, Room 101 host and stand-up Frank Skinner and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, first aired in June and hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, London Hughes, Rhys James and Milton Jones. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Andrew and Kevin enjoy sitting around a campfire, so set their imaginations ablaze to create an awesome fire pit.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: The brothers dream up a spa-like shower with a view of the lake and an open roof for some stargazing.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Berniers head to Las Vegas, where they bid on gym equipment and slot machines abandoned in storage units.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Berniers continue to bid on abandoned storage units in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori Bernier head to Boston, where an old rival causes problems for them.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys pick through a collection of American Civil War memorabilia, and also find a rare motorcycle engine.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Two young men are stabbed outside a fast-food restaurant. The police catch the suspects, and one is upset at the prospect of surrendering his trainers at custody.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Police spot two men acting suspiciously, and a pursuit ensues. James and Anthony drive home a drunk man they found at the roadside.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than Â£1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event in London, as amateur drivers put their home-made, gravity-powered vehicles through an obstacle-littered course. The judges for the event at Alexandra Palace were snowboarder Katie Ormerod, racing driver Andrew Jordan, grime artist Blakie and 2015 Red Bull Soapbox Race podium finisher Tony Whitelaw, while contestants included Team Brooklands Special, 24 Seconds of Le Ally Pally and Team Rockin' Rolla.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy accidentally runs over a pet rabbit belonging to the daughter of an important client, so she needs someone to help cover her tracks. Unfortunately, the best people she has are Lee and Daisy. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee, Lucy and Daisy go on a skiing trip to Eastern Europe, but as usual disaster isn't far behind. The trio of friends find themselves stuck in a cable car with a handful of other nervous tourists - one of whom just happens to be pregnant. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy becomes a relationship counsellor, so Lee and his father take advantage of her new-found skills in an effort to patch things up between them. Can they finally forgive and forget? Bobby Ball guest stars as Frank, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Pulp Fiction (1994)
programme.desc: A series of interlinked stories about the Los Angeles underworld. A hitman plays minder to his boss's wife, and he and his partner deal with a dead body following a mishap with a gun. Meanwhile, a washed-up boxer goes on the run after refusing to throw a fight, and two lovers plot a hold-up in a diner. Quentin Tarantino's crime drama, starring John Travolta, Samuel L Jackson, Uma Thurman, Bruce Willis, Ving Rhames, Tim Roth and Amanda Plummer.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.sub-title: Tudor Parfitt & The Lost Tribes of Israel
programme.desc: The claims of British historian, writer, broadcaster and adventurer Professor Tudor Parfitt, who says he located an African tribe of Jews called the Lemba whose roots can be traced back to the Jews of the Old Testament.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the staff of Moses, one of the more astonishing miracles depicted in the Bible as Moses turned his staff into a snake.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Skeleton analysis is used to uncover more about medieval life, with this instalment focusing on a well-preserved knight found in St Bees, Cumbria. Presented by Tim Sutherland, Malin Holst and Simon Richardson.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The 1415 Battle of Agincourt and its Band of Brothers. Henry V's victory against a numerically superior French army ushered in a new period in the Hundred Years' War.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The mysterious death of the Duke of Kent in a 1942 plane crash, which has led to accusations of the Royal family erasing him from history.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Documentary exploring unusual rail networks from around the world, beginning with a look at trains in cities, including an inverted monorail in Wuppertal, Germany. With contributions from Susana Esteves da Fonseca.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The wilderness lines that have pushed the frontiers of human endeavour into previously unknown territories, solving a set of complex problems along the way.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How railway engineers have crossed valleys, canyons and waterways, including the Forth Bridge and a viaduct in rural New Zealand.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How engineers have built railways across mountains, including tunnels through the Swiss Alps and an Australian track that runs up a near-vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling a year in the existence of 1,000-year-old Windsor Castle and its inhabitants, from the housekeeper and chefs to the Queen herself, who has allowed her public and private life to be documented more extensively than ever before. The state visit of former President of France Jacques Chirac sees the staff organise a banquet and a performance of a West End musical inside the building - but protesters outside threaten to mar proceedings.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Hampton Court Palace, which started out life as a Tudor palace in 1515 and is famous for being the home of King Henry VIII.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A woman's severed leg is found in the grass at the side of a motorway and Taggart and Livingstone are brought into the investigation. As the body parts build up Taggart finds himself no closer to the solution and the investigation leads them to a butcher who becomes a prime suspect. However, when he turns up dead, killed with the same gun as the dismembered corpse, it appears to be another dead end.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: A ballet company commissions the sisters to design its costumes, a deal which could lead to both fame and fortune for their fashion house - but Jack is concerned over the amount of time the choreographer is spending with Beatrice. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet, Aden Gillett, Louise Lombard and David de Keyser.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The sleuthing 12th-century monk investigates a murder as the Abbey becomes involved in the war between King Stephen and the Empress Maud. The trail of clues leads him to a cache of hidden treasure and the fleeing daughter of the castle's owner, Godith. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer's visiting American cousin flees the UK with the loot from a raid on Wakering Hall. Feature-length Christmas special from 1993, guest starring John Gielgud and Ken Kercheval.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Richard Sharpe becomes a pawn in a French plan to retain control of Spain, and finds himself facing execution for murder. Determined to regain his honour, he undertakes a dangerous quest to find the only person capable of clearing his name. Adaptation of Bernard Cornwell's novel, starring Sean Bean.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Moth
programme.desc: Feature-length version of the drama set at the turn of the 20th century, about the fortunes of a carpenter who moves to the country to start work in his uncle's furniture business, but finds himself forced to seek employment with a beguiling woman known locally as the Moth. Jack Davenport and Justine Waddell star.

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: First in a two-part adaptation of Emily Bronte's classic tale. In 1815, Mr Earnshaw returns home from Liverpool with orphan Heathcliff, who befriends his daughter Cathy but is resented by his son Hindley. Upon his father's death 10 years later, Hindley inherits Wuthering Heights and forces Heathcliff to live in the stables, while Cathy must choose between a life of comfort and her love for Heathcliff. Tom Hardy, Charlotte Riley, Andrew Lincoln and Sarah Lancashire star.

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Conclusion. Tormented by his love for Cathy, Heathcliff arrives at Thrushcross Grange the day after her wedding to Edgar. Tension mounts as the pair acknowledge their passion for one another, but when she falls pregnant with Edgar's child, Heathcliff leaves Gimmerton to marry Isabella. Tom Hardy, Charlotte Riley, Andrew Lincoln, Rosalind Halstead and Burn Gorman star in Emily Bronte's classic tale.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Detective Inspector Mike Shepherd is sent to the New Zealand town of Brokenwood to investigate the death of a farmer, after his body is found by two local fishermen. As he uncovers a family's tragedies and secrets, he also learns that Brokenwood is a place where shadows lurk just beneath the surface. Drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Diamonds Are a Gal's Best Friend
programme.desc: What starts as a simple case of a missing horse leads the team into the gardens of Toronto's elite in pursuit of a murderous jewel thief.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh returns to his Bafta-winning role of the Swedish detective in three adaptations of stories by Henning Mankell. Wallander moves into a new home with his girlfriend, only for their dreams of domestic bliss to be shattered when they discover a skeleton in the garden. He must find the killer if he has any hopes of getting his life settled again - and is surprised to discover the body was buried more recently than he first thought. Saskia Reeves and Sarah Smart co-star.

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows (2011)
programme.desc: The detective investigates a series of seemingly unconnected crimes all around the world, and becomes convinced one man is behind them all - the elusive Professor Moriarty. He sets forth on an international journey to bring the evil mastermind to justice, but finds he is dealing with a foe who is his intellectual equal. Detective thriller sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jude Law, Noomi Rapace and Jared Harris.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon hosts an I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here special, in which comedian Jimmy Carr, former Queen of the Jungle Stacey Solomon, TV presenter Myleene Klass and DJ Tony Blackburn must identify 'who habitates in a house like this?'.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A former disaster specialist comes out of retirement to help Virgil and Gordon cap a leaking gas reserve.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is take to the wheel of a high-powered sports car, but can he drift it and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's in a triathlon and takes Fizz's superhuman strength headband, which Fizz needs to beat the President at a thumb war.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: It's cold, the boiler is broken, and Mr. Bean has to get warm, fast..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George wins tickets to the local stately home. It's not long before Dave and the rest of the Spuds find themselves lost in its maze..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Tony Hadley of Spandau Ballet and award-winning chefs Michael Caines and Frances Atkins. With contributions from wine expert Oz Clarke and cupcake queen Melissa Morgan, who offers some tips on making vegan cakes.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Lisa Faulkner makes chicken liver pate and homemade melba toast, while John Torode prepares a beef Wellington with dauphinoise potatoes and cauliflower cheese - with a difference.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha and chef Mark Sergeant prepare a New Year feast, featuring a 'full Spanish' for breakfast, roasted poussin for lunch and a foolproof beef Wellington.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet is joined by chef Merrilees Parker, who serves up a range of party food for New Year's Eve, including baby baked canape potatoes filled with smoked mackerel pate.

programme.title: Despicable Me 2 (2013)
programme.desc: A reformed criminal mastermind who has abandoned his wicked ways for a life of fatherhood and jam-making helps a secret agent to bring one of his fellow evil geniuses to justice. The villain in question has stolen a dangerous experimental serum with the power to turn harmless animals into ravening monsters. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell and Kristen Wiig.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Adam Garcia, Carol Decker, Holly Walsh and Rylan Clark-Neal pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants James Jordan, Fiona Wade and Louis Walsh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win Â£50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the singing contest in which a celebrity panel and a studio audience must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. In the first episode, Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong make up the panel, trying to identify the performers inside a bee, a duck, a unicorn, a hedgehog, a butterfly and a chameleon.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor joins the show as the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a special celebrity edition of the big money quiz. In the first episode the contestants in the hot seat are Frank Skinner, Naga Munchetty and Martine McCutcheon, who compete to answer 15 questions correctly and win Â£1 million for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: Keith Lemon teams up with Paddy McGuinness to remake Steven Spielberg's 1993 dinosaur-based classic Jurassic Park. The duo are helped by Sian Gibson, Sally Phillips, George Potts, Shaun Ryder and Bernie Clifton to reimagine the story of genetically engineered dinosaurs that escape from an eccentric tycoon's safari park and go on the rampage.

programme.title: Nostradamus Decoded
programme.desc: Examining the 16th century French apothecary's famously obscure publications, and whether the prophecies hidden within his texts can be believed.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Phill Jupitus and Andy Parsons, oversees a clash between The Corner House from Windsor and The Royal Oak from the West Midlands.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic compilation of the craziest drivers. Featuring reckless pedestrians, the Bonneville Salt Flats, casual collisions and more outrageous stunts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Massive explosions rip through a Brazilian chemical plant forcing local residents to flee for their lives, and an accident on an aircraft carrier sends a jet crashing into the sea.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A tornado causes destruction in Kansas and a freak accident catapults a racer into the path of a speeding boat. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: The Pelletiers are striving to double production, but then several machines break down and two crew members threaten to quit.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics revamp a man's convertible that he has owned for 15 years.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: The design and construction of supercars, beginning with the Aston Martin V12 Vantage S.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: Bentley's plans to develop and build a worthy successor to its Continental GT V8, a much-respected coupe that served its manufacturer well.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China restore a Jaguar XJS to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China take the finished Jaguar XJS for a test drive and invite potential buyers to view it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an XK8 Jaguar in poor condition, giving mechanic Edd China a tough challenge to fix it up within a tight budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes a risk on a classic Jaguar E-type in poor condition, but quickly discovers the expense of buying parts as Edd China gets to work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a Jaguar Mark 2 - but is later left to reflect whether the purchase has been a wise one as mechanic Edd China reports a list of serious defects.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China restore a Jaguar XJC, an iconic 'corporate sports car' that is likely to attract plenty of admirers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to buy a Rolls-Royce but takes a chance when offered a 1984 Bentley Mulsanne Turbo, much to the dismay of Edd China when he sees the paintwork.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Kevin poses as an interviewer to gain access to a Westwind jet, Ken and Danny valet a car to get the keys to a Cessna CJ3, and Mike repos an air ambulance.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy calls in his team to snag a Czechoslovakian fighter jet, and Ken Cage and Danny Thompson end up under fire after going after a $2million Citation CJ1.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve battles flooded highways when his truck breaks down, leaving him stranded. Later, tensions flare when trainee trucker Danyelle gets a driving lesson from her husband.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The Goblin Works Garage gang opens a bigger workshop to cope with demand, going bolder than ever before with design and restoration work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to the US to hunt for a DeLorean DMC-12, a car that ceased production in 1982. Once he has acquired one, Edd China is given the task of restoring the stainless steel-clad vehicle, which was manufactured in Belfast.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Catholic church in Liverpool, Drew Pritchard's prayers are answered with a pair of very rare chairs. In Leicestershire, he finds industrial gems in the world's largest bell foundry.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard haggles hard at a museum of vintage farm equipment in Exmouth. Later, he is bowled over by an amazing collection of arts and crafts furniture.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.desc: A violent crack tears the MSC Napoli apart and leaves the crew stranded. As the investigators dig into the cause of the wreck, they discover an alarming design flaw.

programme.title: Cuba's Secret Shark Lair
programme.desc: In 1945, one of the largest sharks ever recorded was captured in Cuban waters. Now, two teams of researchers return to seek out huge hammerhead and great white sharks.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: The documentary series looks into the so-called 'space fireflies', which reportedly attack astronauts' brains.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: My Chin Keeps Growing: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: In America, a man has a huge mass on his chin after his body was attacked by an aggressive form of bone cancer.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Louisiana student Mickey Shunick, who went missing after a night out in May 2012. Police failed to make a breakthrough until they spoted her on surveillance footage. Eventually a registered sex offender pleaded guilty to killing the 21-year-old, and also being responsible for the death of another woman whose body had been found in September 1999.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of University of Florida student Christian Aguilar, who vanished from his campus in September 2012. Police were stumped until CCTV footage took the case in a shocking new direction, helping lead them to the 18-year-old's body.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The work of investigators and scientists at the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms who are dedicated to preventing terrorism and reducing violent crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of a boy and his mother who were kidnapped by a vicious drug cartel, and how the FBI prosecuted all the members of the gang through the use of surveillance.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Investigators Hairston and Dowe remove animals including a pig from the home of a hoarder they have previously encountered.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Two girls wait anxiously as Dr Chris Brown works to save their rabbit.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An Australian kelpie is brought to the surgery after a knock to its head causes severe difficulties with balancing, and a brain scan reveals the problems are inoperable.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman lets her mother choose a dress for her, and another customer has been given an unlimited budget by her father - but her choices do not please her mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nightclub worker Emily wants a sexy look for her big day, but her mother has more conservative ideas and tries to persuade her to tone it down a little.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of staff at Bridals by Lori in the Atlanta suburb of Sandy Springs, as well as meeting customers searching for the perfect wedding dress. Bride-to-be Haley clashes with her grandmother over her choice of gown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is desperate to save the life of a frail three-day old foal that has just been orphaned. Plus, Dr Lisa Chimes is trying to help a greedy cat that ate a 50cm ribbon.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown looks after Lulu, a sneezing Labradoodle, while Dr Lisa Chimes strives to a save a dog that has been bitten by an infected tick.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Twenty nine-year-old twins Brandi and Kandi are close after a traumatic childhood, seeing food as a comfort. After weight-loss surgery, more challenges await the pair.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lacey has ballooned to over 600lbs and must now rally her divorced parents around her and find a way to modulate her moods that won't include binge-eating.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lacey has ballooned to over 600lbs and must now rally her divorced parents around her and find a way to modulate her moods that won't include binge-eating.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.desc: Spin-off from the reality series following the staff of a Sydney bridal boutique. The first episode features a customer with a big entourage but no fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.desc: A customer is prepared to spend a lot of money on her dream gown, while another bride hopes to impress the five friends she has brought to her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.desc: A bride has expensive tastes but a limited budget, and a customer travels from America to Australia to buy a dress for a wedding in the Bahamas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.sub-title: It Takes a Village to Buy a Dress
programme.desc: A bride finds dress shopping a more emotional experience than expected, and a customer may have finally made her choice after trying on 60 gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Wendi is searching for the perfect gown after not getting to wear one in her first wedding, while Shannon hopes her dress will still fit perfectly.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.desc: New Zealand women's hockey star Gemma searches for the ideal dress to impress her entourage, who are considered a 'tough crowd'.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: This edition highlights the relationship between brides and their mothers as Peter 'Franc' Kelly helps three very different women search for a trio of diverse dresses.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: Fabric, cut, shape and tailoring are the most important thing for the three fashion-conscious brides who are in the store this week for advice from Peter 'Franc' Kelly.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: Clare Cullen, Renata Silva and Nicola Andrews all arrive in the store accompanied by their best friends as Peter 'Franc' Kelly advises three more brides-to-be.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: Franc meets one bride whose mum has terminal cancer and another who is so petite she does not want to look like she is wearing a holy communion dress when she walks down the aisle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: Peter 'Franc' Kelly meets three brides-to-be with large families to keep happy, and it could turn out to be his toughest day yet.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa performs a reading for Olivia Munn and her mother, and also takes a look back at some of the most memorable episodes involving mothers.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa and Larry get a taste of life in Florida, and the medium's family tries to persuade the couple to settle there permanently.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Phyllis and Patty have already lost one home as a result of their hoarding and now they look set to lose another.

programme.title: Murder By Numbers
programme.desc: A killer who roamed the streets of Baton Rouge, Louisiana, leaving three women raped and murdered. Another survived a vicious attack and was able to help police find the assailant.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of Levi Bellfield, who denied his connection to a series of murders and rapes. However, videotaped police interviews told a different story.

programme.title: Mummy's Little Murderer
programme.desc: On May 7, 2011, 20-year-old Elliot Turner strangled his girlfriend Emily Longley and persuaded his doting parents to help him cover up the crime. This documentary examines events surrounding the murder, the investigation and the trial, and features interviews with family, friends, police and prosecutors, as well as covert recordings, surveillance footage and personal archive material.
